alert.note: Alert for Reagan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN REAGAN COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 249 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barnhart, or 12 miles southeast of Big Lake, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Reagan County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
